availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G. Cole (Magoffin County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Cole and Katharine Cole. Married to Perlina Marshall Cole. Father of Johnson M. Cole, Fady Cole, Fleming Cole, and Greenville Cole. Laborer in Floyd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 450B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 446.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, Precinct 5, p. 378A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Floyd County Births, p. 68.
"William G. Cole (1834-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 167905600, accessed November 7, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/167905600.
